Posts.Content: May 13, 2012 10:43PM Joanne_53 wrote: purple --- I had my surgery in January and had physio after for the pain and ROM in my arm and shoulder -- this worked great.  Since then I have now been doing rads and back at physio -- having the arm up and over while on the radiation table has flared it again.  I have 2 rad treatments left and looking forward to the end of that but will continue with physio for a bit longer. Good luck -
Posts.Title: SNB ...underarm movement/pain etc purple32 purple32

Posts.Content: Feb 24, 2012 03:03PM Joanne_53 wrote: Ysa, I can understand what you are going through.  Before your surgery, you need to speak to your Breast Surgeon about your shoulder too -- the positioning of your arm during surgery will cause post surgery discomfort so if she/he knows ahead then they can try to position it differently.  Since my surgery I have rotator cuff tendonitis and just now starting physio for it.  Now to your problem about cortisone --- have you tried acupuncture or reflexology -- these are obviously just a suggestion to help with the pain until you can have it looked after at a later date.  Good luck and I hope you find relief soon.

Posts.Content: Mar 12, 2012 04:19PM Joanne_53 wrote: Thank you Kim for sharing this with us.  My thoughts and prayers are with Susan's family and friends.  Below is a poem that we had read at my mother's funeral -- This poem was read at Queen Elizabeth's mother's funeral.  We are Canadian and my mother said if it was good enough for the Queen Mum then it is good enough for me.  I think it says so much ....   She is Gone You can shed tears that she is gone or you can smile because she has lived. You can close your eyes and pray that she'll come back or you can open your eyes and see all she's left. Your heart can be empty because you can't see her or you can be full of the love you shared. You can turn your back on tomorrow and live yesterday or you can be happy for tomorrow because of yesterday. You can remember her and only that she's gone or you can cherish her memory and let it live on. You can cry and close your mind, be empty and turn your back or you can do what she'd want: smile, open your eyes, love and go on.

Posts.Content: Apr 30, 2012 10:13PM Joanne_53 wrote: Leelee, I have to agree with Marie -- Please wait until you have your mammogram and have the results.  Right now you are in reaction mode which is not healthy to you or your family.  When you get the results, which hopefully will not be cancer, then let us know.  Regardless of the results, we are all here for you ... if you need us.  Let's hope you don't. Also as Marie said, no disprespect intended.
Posts.Title: so worried I have breast cancer leelee101 leelee101

Posts.Content: May 9, 2012 12:26PM Joanne_53 wrote: leelee - talk to the doctor -- if the mammo did not have a call back then things are good --- be happy, don't look for the negative !!!
Posts.Title: so worried I have breast cancer leelee101 leelee101

Posts.Content: Apr 24, 2012 04:24PM - edited Apr 24, 2012 04:26PM by Joanne_53 Leelee -- you need to get a doctor to see you at that clinic and then get a referral for a mammogram -- There is no need to panic until you get this far.  Once you have the mammogram then you will at least know if there is anything there.  If there is anything, then it can be investigated further.  I felt the lump and then went to my GP who sent me for the mammogram, then ultra sound .... So ... that is the start.  We are all here for you but the best thing for you is to at least find out what it is.  Keep us posted.

Posts.Content: Feb 20, 2012 08:00PM Joanne_53 wrote: I am having fun reading everyone's posts .... scream cream .. you can buy something very similar to this from "Passion Party", they are home parties that are more fun then Tupperware.  I like the various K-Y products to be honest ... but for my skin, I am going to try the Coconut Oil .. I have heard great things and I have a form of eczema which displays almost like psoriasis. I do have a prescription from the Dermotologist but am willing to try anything.  One of the virtures of Coconut Oil is eczema and I say that this is worth a try. Joanne

Posts.Content: Sep 3, 2012 02:47PM Joanne_53 wrote: Cats, there are radiation threads on here too. I used glaxol base which comes in a tub .. Ou can get it at Walmart or Costco. My RON recommended it. Be sure to cover you entire breast and underarm after treatment and at night. I too got very dark and the I peeled. Do not put anything on for up to 2 hours prior to treatment. I hope this is helpful. I finished rads in May and am still very dark under my arm.
Posts.Title: In shock bennymuffins websister

Posts.Content: Oct 5, 2012 03:49PM Joanne_53 wrote: Bennymuffin ..... First ... I wore a bra to bed for at least 6 weeks ... That was the instruction from the surgeon Second ... No lifting over 10 pounds ... You are only asking for trouble I had an infection in the lymph node incision ... It was painful and I let it go. If it get really bad go to the ER. You can try heat or ice but be sure it not directly on your skin. Take care,of yourself. You are just at the beginning if this "journey" Joanne
